get.description: AP uplink profile, configure the uplink parameters, such like ethernet uplink, cellular uplink, preemption parameters, management VLAN, etc.

post.description: List of uplink profiles, configure the uplink parameters, such like ethernet uplink, cellular uplink, preemption parameters, management VLAN, etc.

get.description: List of uplink profiles, configure the uplink parameters, such like ethernet uplink, cellular uplink, preemption parameters, management VLAN, etc.

patch.description: List of uplink profiles, configure the uplink parameters, such like ethernet uplink, cellular uplink, preemption parameters, management VLAN, etc.

delete.description: List of uplink profiles, configure the uplink parameters, such like ethernet uplink, cellular uplink, preemption parameters, management VLAN, etc.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaApUplink_ApUplinksSchema.description: AP uplink profile, configure the uplink parameters, such like ethernet uplink, cellular uplink, preemption parameters, management VLAN, etc.

profile.description: List of uplink profiles, configure the uplink parameters, such like ethernet uplink, cellular uplink, preemption parameters, management VLAN, etc.

ap-mode.x-typeDescription: AP mode, campus or microbranch or instant.
ap-mode.description: AP campus or microbranch or Instant mode.

gateway-detect.description: Re-trigger DHCP once the ARP entry for the APs default gateway is lost

domain-name.x-typeDescription:
The domain-name type represents a DNS domain name.
Fully quallified left to the models which utilize this type.

Internet domain names are only loosely specified.  Section
3.5 of RFC 1034 recommends a syntax (modified in Section
2.1 of RFC 1123).  The pattern above is intended to allow
for current practice in domain name use, and some possible
future expansion.  It is designed to hold various types of
domain names, including names used for A or AAAA records
(host names) and other records, such as SRV records.  Note
that Internet host names have a stricter syntax (described
in RFC 952) than the DNS recommendations in RFCs 1034 and
1123, and that systems that want to store host names in
schema nodes using the domain-name type are recommended to
adhere to this stricter standard to ensure interoperability.

The encoding of DNS names in the DNS protocol is limited
to 255 characters.  Since the encoding consists of labels
prefixed by a length bytes and there is a trailing NULL
byte, only 253 characters can appear in the textual dotted
notation.

Domain-name values use the US-ASCII encoding.  Their canonical
format uses lowercase US-ASCII characters.  Internationalized
domain names MUST be encoded in punycode as described in RFC
3492

x-enumDescriptions.UPLINK: Eth1 is bonded with eth0 both working as uplink.
x-enumDescriptions.DOWNLINK: Eth1 is NOT bonded with eth0.

eth0-mode.x-typeDescription: Configures eth0 working as uplink or downlink.
eth0-mode.description: Configures the ethernet port 0 working as uplink or downlink.

x-enumDescriptions.BONDED_UPLINK: Eth1 is bonded into bond0 working as uplink.
x-enumDescriptions.NOT_BONDED_UPLINK: Eth1 is NOT bonded into bond0.

eth1-mode.x-typeDescription: Configures eth1 bonded with eth0 or not.
eth1-mode.description: Configures the ethernet port 1 working as uplink bonded with eth0 or not.

uplink-tagged-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
uplink-tagged-vlan.description: Allow AP to get the IP address from a tagged VLAN.

uplink-native-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

uplink_customerized_vlan.description: Configures the ethernet port 0 working as uplink or downlink.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

resolver-alias.description: Aliases for the list of DNS name servers.

ipv6-address-auto.description: Enable automatic IPv6 address configuration based on IPv6 RA advertisements.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

resolver-alias.description: Aliases for the list of DNS name servers.

lte-modem.description:
Uplink LTE Modem, this feature is used to configure modem parameters
for 3G or 4G uplink and only applies to AP, the 3G and 4G modems can be used to extend connectivity to places
and enables the AP to automatically choose the available network in a specific region.
This feature supports configuring both 3rd party modem and aruba modem, but only one modem can be used as the uplink.

wifi-uplink.description:
Wifi uplink, this feature is used to configure ARUBA AP as a standard WiFi client to assoc with Aruba ap or third party devices.
When both sides are Aruba AP, Aruba Mesh should be the first choice.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

ap-mode.x-typeDescription: AP mode, campus or microbranch or instant.
ap-mode.description: AP campus or microbranch or Instant mode.

gateway-detect.description: Re-trigger DHCP once the ARP entry for the APs default gateway is lost

lte-modem.description:
Uplink LTE Modem, this feature is used to configure modem parameters
for 3G or 4G uplink and only applies to AP, the 3G and 4G modems can be used to extend connectivity to places
and enables the AP to automatically choose the available network in a specific region.
This feature supports configuring both 3rd party modem and aruba modem, but only one modem can be used as the uplink.

wifi-uplink.description:
Wifi uplink, this feature is used to configure ARUBA AP as a standard WiFi client to assoc with Aruba ap or third party devices.
When both sides are Aruba AP, Aruba Mesh should be the first choice.

enable.description:
Enables pre-emption when no uplinks are enforced. When enabled, if the current uplink is active,
the AP periodically tries to use a higher priority uplink, and switches to a higher priority uplink even if the current uplink is active.

Enables uplink switchover based on the availability of the Internet. When enabled, the
AP continuously sends ICMP packets to some well-known Internet servers. If the request
is timed out due to a bad uplink connection or uplink interface failure, and the public
Internet is not reachable from the current uplink, the AP switches to a different connection.

zone.

or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

ip-for-cell.description: Configures the Internet failover IP address for a cellular 3G/4G uplink.

timeout.description: Configures the number of seconds after which the Internet based uplink verification times out.

pkt-lost-cnt.description:
Configures the number of packets that are to be lost when verifying the uplink availability
using the Internet.

pkt-send-freq.description:
Configures the frequency in seconds, at which the ICMP packets are sent to verify the
uplink availability using the Internet.

vpn-timeout.description: Configures a duration to wait for an uplink switch based on VPN status.

backup-link.description: Mark uplink as a hot-standby uplink.

ArubaApUplink_UplinkPppoeConfig.description: Grouping for the uplink IPv4 PPPoE configurations

uplink-pppoe.description: Container for the uplink IPv4 PPPoE configurations

password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

secret.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

x-enumDescriptions.ETH0_ETH1: Both ethernet port eth0 and eth1.

interface-mode.description: Interface access or trunk mode for VLANs.

native-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
native-vlan.description:
Native VLAN id for untagged frames arriving on
a trunk interface.  Tagged frames sent on an interface
configured with a native VLAN should have their tags
stripped prior to transmission. This configuration is only
valid on a trunk interface.

access-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
access-vlan.description: Assign the access VLAN to the access port.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description: VLAN ranges that the interface may carry when in trunk mode.

trunk-vlan-all.description: Allow all vlans for trunk mode interface.

x-enumDescriptions.NATIVE_VLAN: AP management vlan is native vlan.
x-enumDescriptions.TAGGED_VLAN: AP management vlan is tagged vlan.

mgmt-vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
Dynamic client type to obtain IPv4 address.

ipv4-management-alias.description: Alias for IPv4 address, this could be static or dynamic

x-enumDescriptions.STABLE_PRIVACY_ALGORITHM: Generate IPv6 address with Stable Provacy Algorithm.

wan-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

x-enumDescriptions.MPLS: WAN circuit type is MultiProtocol Label Switching.

wan-type.description: Access technology of this WAN uplink.

ArubaApUplink_UplinkDot1xsuppConfig.description: Grouping for AP uplink dot1x config.

uplink-dot1xsupp.description: Container for AP uplink dot1x config.

x-enumDescriptions.EAP_MD5: MD5 hash function to generate hashed password

eapol-method.description: EAP method to use for authentication.

x-enumDescriptions.DEVICE: Device certificate stored in the Trusted Platform Module (TPM)
x-enumDescriptions.EST: EST(Enrollment over Secure Transport protocol) certificate.

eap-tls-cert-type.description: The type of certificate to use for EAP-TLS authentication.

eap-identity-password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
eap-identity-password.description: Plaintext password associated with the EAP identity.

auth-timeout.description:
Time period (in seconds) to wait for a successful authentication
before terminating further authentication attempts until the device is
rebooted.

validate-server-cert.description: Enable the device to validate the server certificate.

ArubaApUplink_CellSimPin.description:
AP uplink cellular sim pin is a security method to protect the SIM card from unauthorized access,
the following operations can be configured for the sim pin:
1.sim-pin-enable: enable SIM PIN lock
2.sim-pin-renew: update the current SIM PIN
3.sim-pin-puk: unlock the SIM PIN using PUK.

sim-pin-enable.description: Enables locking of the SIM PIN, to enable SIM PIN lock, the PIN code should be same as the PIN code that is currently used.

current.description: Current PIN of the modem SIM.

sim-pin-renew.description: Renews the SIM PIN of the modem, update the current SIM PIN by entering a new SIM PIN.

current.description: Current PIN of the modem SIM.

new.description: New SIM PIN for the modem.

sim-pin-puk.description: Unlocks the SIM PIN using the PUK code provided by the ISP and by entering a new PIN code.

ArubaApUplink_WifiUplinkConfig.description: Wifi uplink network topology config grouping.

ssid-name.description: Defines a unique name for the network on which the Wi-Fi uplink will be enabled

uplink-band.description: Configures the band for uplink connection. Range: 802.11a, 802.11g, 802.116GHz (For Wi-Fi 6E capable access points) Default: 802.11g

x-enumDescriptions.ENTERPRISE: Use WPA-TKIP and WPA2-CCMP for 802.1X authentication

password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

eap-server.description: Validates the server certificate when TLS method is used for 802.1X authentication.

wpa-passphrase.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
wpa-passphrase.description: Defines a WPA passphrase with which a PSK can be generated.The passphrase must be between 8 and 64 characters.

disable-on-mesh-point.description: In Mesh deployments, the configurations are synced to all peer APs, irrespective of their mesh roles. Use this command to disable the configuration of wifi uplink on mesh points. When this is configured the only the master AP uses wi-fi uplink to connect to the Internet.

ArubaCellular_ThirdPartyModemConfig.description: cellular uplink configurations for third party modem.

x-enumDescriptions.SIERRA_EVDO: the driver for Sierra EVDO modem.
x-enumDescriptions.SIERRA_GSM: the driver for Sierra GSM modem.
x-enumDescriptions.PANTECH_3G: the driver for Pantech UML290 modem (3G mode).
x-enumDescriptions.ETHER_3G: the driver for Novatal MC551 modem.
x-enumDescriptions.SIERRA_NET: the driver for Sierra Net modem.
x-enumDescriptions.RNDIS_U770: the driver for Franklin U770/U772 modem.
x-enumDescriptions.RNDIS_L800: the driver for Alcatel L800 modem.
x-enumDescriptions.HUAWEI_CDC: the driver for Huawei E3372/E3276 modem.
x-enumDescriptions.NOVATEL_U620: the driver for Novatel U620L modem.
x-enumDescriptions.RNDIS_UML295: the driver for Pantech UML295 modem.

tp-driver-type.x-typeDescription: the driver required for 3G or 4G modem.
tp-driver-type.description:
The device driver required for 3G or 4G modem, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.
Range: OPTION, ACM, AIRPRIME, HSO, SIERRA_EVDO, SIERRA_GSM, PANTECH_3G, ETHER_3G, SIERRA_NET,
RNDIS_U770, RNDIS_L800, HUAWEI_CDC, NOVATEL_U620, RNDIS_UML295, SIERRA_GOBI, ZTE_CDC, ARUBA_GOBI

tp-device-id.description: The device ID of the modem, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

tp-device-tty.description: The modem TTY port, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

tp-init-parameters.description: The parameter name to initialize the modem, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

tp-cell-auth.description:
Cellular authentication parameters,these parameters are important credentials used to verify user identity,
these parameters are typically provided by ISP to ensure that only authorized users can access the network.

type.description:
The authentication type for modem, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.
Range: PAP, CHAP

username.description:
The username of subscriber of selected Internet Service Provider,
this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

password.description:
The password for the account associated with the subscriber of the selected Internet Service Provider,
this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

tp-dial-cmd.description: The parameter to dial the cell tower, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

tp-modeswitch-cmd.description:
The parameter used to switch modem from storage mode to modem mode,
this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

tp-isp.x-typeDescription: Name of the Internet Service Provider to connect.
tp-isp.description:
The name of the Internet Service Provider to connect, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.
Range: CINCINNATI_BELL, VIRGIN, TELECOM, TELENOR, VODAFONE_SMARTONE, O2, SFR, ORANGE, HUTCH, OPTUS,
SINGTEL, HKCSL, VERIZON, RELIANCE, TATA_INDICOM, AIRTEL_3G, NOKIA_CS_10, NTT, KDDI, MOVISTAR, CHINA_TELECOM,
CHINA_UNICOM, VODAFONE, NETCOM, T_MOBILE, MOBILY, EMOBILE, SPRINT, CRICKET, VODAFONE_3G, AIRTEL, ATT,
BELL, DEUTSCH_TELEKOM, ICE, TELSTRA, CHINA_MOBILE

tp-country.description: The country for the deployment, this API is AP specific and only for 3rd party modem.

ArubaCellular_ArubaModemConfig.description: Cellular uplink configurations for Aruba modem.

aruba-skylark.description: Skylark profile has been created and enabled and all other modems are disabled.

plmn.description:
The Public Land Mobile Network(PLMN) identifier, this API is Aruba modem specific.
For AP, valid length: 5 or 6 digits

modem-apn.description:
Modem APN(Access Point Name) Configuration is used by modem to connect to a mobile network
for internet access, this configuration help the modem identify the correct network and establish a data connection.

apn.description: The Access Point Name(APN) of modem, this API is Aruba modem specific.

apn-authentication.description: APN authentication type. 0 - NONE, 1 - PAP, 2 - CHAP, 3 - MSCHAPv2

gps.description: Enable the GPS on the Aruba modem, this API is AP specific and only for Aruba modem

x-enumDescriptions.AUTO: the network mode for aruba modem is automatic.
x-enumDescriptions.MODE_4G: the network mode for aruba modem is 4G.
x-enumDescriptions.MODE_3G: the network mode for aruba modem is 3G.
x-enumDescriptions.CUSTOM: Custom mode used by Central UI. Not used for CLI configuration.

network-mode.x-typeDescription: the cellular network mode for Aruba modem.
network-mode.description:
The cellular network mode for Aruba modem, this API is Aruba modem specific.
Following values are valid for AP:
AUTO: connects to whichever mode is available.
MODE_4G: connects to only 4G networks.
MODE_3G: connects to only 3G networks.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: when SIM config is not required.

sim-slot.x-typeDescription: the SIM slot for Aruba modem.
sim-slot.description: SIM slot for internal Aruba modem, this API is Aruba modem specific.

data-rate-limit.description: Data rate limit for cellular Connection(Mbps).

modem-e3372.description: Enabling/Disabling the Cellular profile for Huawei E3372h-320 modem.

auto-upgrade.description: Automatic firmware upgrade for Aruba modem, this API is AP specific and only for Aruba modem.

sim-failover.description: Enable Sim failover for uplink manager configuration.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: when prefer-modem config is not required.

prefer-modem.description: The preferred modem, this API is AP specific and only for Aruba modem.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.
